nl.sense_os.service.storage

Class ParserUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.sense_os.service.storage.ParserUtils

  • public class ParserUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Hacky solution for parsing SQL-like queries on the LocalStorage. Normal ContentProviders will not need this class because they can handle these queries themselves, but our LocalStorage class does not.
    Author:
    Steven Mulder
    See Also:
    LocalStorage

    • Method Detail

      • getSelectedDeviceUuid

        public static java.lang.String getSelectedDeviceUuid(java.lang.String selection,

      • getSelectedSensors

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSelectedSensors(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> allSensors,
                                                  java.lang.String selection,
                                                  java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
        Tries to parse the selection String to see which data has to be returned for the query. Looks for occurrences of SensorData.DataPoint.SENSOR_NAME and SensorData.DataPoint.SENSOR_DESCRIPTION in the selection String.
        Parameters:
        allSensors - Set of all possible sensors, used to form the selection from.
        selection - Selection string from the query.
        selectionArgs - Selection arguments. Not used yet.
        Returns:
        List of sensor names that are included in the query.

      • getSelectedTimeRange

        public static long[] getSelectedTimeRange(java.lang.String selection,
                          java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
        Tries to parse the selection String to see which data has to be returned for the query. Looks for occurrences of "timestamp" in the selection String.
        Parameters:
        selection - Selection string from the query.
        selectionArgs - Selection arguments. Not used yet.
        Returns:
        Array with minimum and maximum time stamp for the query result.

      • getSelectedTransmitState

        public static int getSelectedTransmitState(java.lang.String selection,
                           java.lang.String[] selectionArgs)
